resent.description: Refusing to forgive others is sinful because it contradicts Jesus's direct command to forgive and His example of mercy, while also blocking God's forgiveness of our own sins.

resent.question: Did you, through thoughts, deliberately abandon your Catholic faith for any length of time?
resent.description: This sin represents a deliberate rejection of God's revealed truth and the covenant relationship established through baptism, breaking the promise to remain faithful to Christ and His Church.

effeminacy.question: Do I fear to say the name of Jesus in private conversations, even when it would be convenient or easier not to?
effeminacy.description: Being ashamed or afraid to proclaim Christ represents a denial of our baptismal call to evangelize, shows lack of trust in God's protection, and fails to fulfill Jesus's command to "go and make disciples of all nations."

effeminacy.question: Do I fear to proclaim Christ in my daily conversations?
effeminacy.description: Being ashamed or afraid to proclaim Christ represents a denial of our baptismal call to evangelize, shows lack of trust in God's protection, and fails to fulfill Jesus's command to "go and make disciples of all nations."

effeminacy.description: Prioritizing human approval over standing firm in God's truth demonstrates both moral cowardice and places human opinion above divine authority.

extracted_data_phrases: by prioritizing others think what is right , rather than standing firm in what I know to be true
rather than standing firm in what I know to be true

effeminacy.description: Prioritizing human approval over standing firm in God's truth demonstrates both moral cowardice and places human opinion above divine authority.

worldliness.question: Do you become overly attached to your possessions?
worldliness.description: From a Catholic perspective, obsessing over possessions is considered sinful because it makes material things an idol that takes precedence over God and prevents spiritual growth while hindering one's ability to be generous and detached from worldly goods.

retaliation.question: Do you harbor thoughts of personal retaliation against others?
retaliation.description: Entertaining thoughts of revenge is sinful because it rejects Christ's teaching of forgiveness and love of enemies, choosing instead to harbor malice and a desire for personal retaliation rather than leaving justice to God.

extracted_data_phrases: on activities that fail to nourish my soul

imprudence.description: Wasteful pursuits squander the precious time God has given us for meaningful spiritual growth and service to others.

extracted_data_phrases: over providing for my family 's needs

prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I allowed excessive and wasteful gambling to compromise my ability to provide for my family's needs or fulfill my financial responsibilities?

vanity.description: Excessive focus on physical appearance reflects vanity and can indicate a lack of trust in God's creation of you as inherently worthy.

extracted_data_phrases: about the past over growth in faith

sensuality.description: Prioritizing worldly pleasures and experiences over spiritual development is considered sinful as it violates the First Commandment by placing temporal desires above one's eternal relationship with God.

sensuality.question: Did I desire worldly pleasures over spiritual growth in my daily life?
sensuality.description: Prioritizing worldly pleasures and experiences over spiritual development is considered sinful as it violates the First Commandment by placing temporal desires above one's eternal relationship with God.

sensuality.description: This sin makes  idol of physical or emotional gratification, turning what should be a gift from God into the primary focus of one's life, displacing God as the center and highest good.

sensuality.question: Did I indulge in sensual gratification through self-stimulation?
sensuality.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it for self-indulgence in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

scandal.question: Did I cause another person to commit a sinful act by my actions?
scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: in something that has weighed heavily on me

callousness.question: Did I neglect to show compassion and care to someone who was ill?

blasphemy.question: Have you spoken the name of Jesus or God in careless or disrespectful words?

autonomy.question: Did I forget to acknowledge God's providence in my life, taking for granted the good things that have occurred?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did you allow doubts about God's existence to creep into your mind?
autonomy.description: Deliberately entertaining doubts about God's existence is a sin against faith because it questions the most fundamental truth of our faith and shows a lack of trust in God's clear self-revelation through creation, scripture, and the Church's teachings.

autonomy.question: Did I rely solely on my own understanding and failed to acknowledge my dependence on God's guidance when making decisions about my life and future?
